content:
invaginating posterior midgut? How do they get there in
its absense?.
folded gastrulation /152 mothers 152 males.
Collect embryos as early and late gastrula (3-5 after
eggs laid)
(Things to think about: Do the posterior cells stain
even though they do not form a posterior midgut? What
does this mean about the zygotic effect of folded
gastrulation.? Is it a selector gene which responds to
some maternal morphogen and establishes the endodermal
lineage? What does the result say about the mechanism
controlling 152 expression?
Kruppel/ 43.03 mothers males.
hairy/ 43.03 mothers hairy/43.03 males.
Collect embryos as blastoderms, early gastrula
(Things to think about: Both these zygotically active
genes affect affect the segmentation pattern. In what
ways do the effects of the gap mutation (Kruppel) differ
from those of the pair rule mutation (hairy), judging
from cuticle preparations of late embryos and
ftz/galactosidase staining at the blastoderm stage? In
what way is the Kruppel pattern similar to that produced
by Bicaudal? (Are some stripes expanded and others
compressed? How are the patterns on the dorsal and
ventral sides of the embryo different and what might
this mean?) What doe this say about the relationship
between Kruppel and Bicaudal. How is hairy different in
its effects?
What is the relationship of all these genes to fushi
tarazu?)
